item.title: Top Down or Bottom Up: Two Paradigms for Artificial General Intelligence
item.description: Artificial General Intelligence (AGI, AKA strong AI, human-level AI) refers an AI that can solve any task a human can. I’m most interested in a conversational AI that is indistinguishable from a human (Turing, 1950). Whatever you call it, there is a dichotomy in building AGI: use one giant neural network, or use more than one. It sounds like an implementation-specific decision, but your opinion will inform your research discipline of choice (assuming you want to build AGI).
